The plant produces distinctive blue spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporocarps. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Bouchardatia cyanosperma plays a role in nutrient cycling and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
